result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paris L Smith Carr

defendant.name: Smith Carr, Paris L
defendant.address: c/o Walworth County Jail, 1770 County Road NN, Elkhorn, WI 53121

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:41 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Paris L Smith Carr appeared by Zoom video, in custody at Walworth Co. Jail.  Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke in court for Paris L Smith Carr.  Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Atty. Redetzke provides an update; he believes his client may be proceeding to a possible plea and sentencing in Walworth Co.  Defendant advises she is resolving her Winnebago Co. case, the Walworth Co. case is just a status date.  Atty. Redetzke is requesting this matter be set for a waiver of preliminary hearing and 16CF697 tag along with for further proceedings. Preliminary time limits waived.  Atty. Redetzke is asking his client appear by Zoom video from Walworth Co. Jail for the next court date.  Court will allow the defendant to appear by Zoom for the next court date.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Prior: 115 W Doty Street, Dane County Jail, Madison, WI 53703 United States

addressed to: Paris L Smith Carr for hearing on November 2, 2022
Return to Sender,  Unable to Forward.
Hearing on November 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:11 AM; Case called for Hearing. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane.  Defendant Paris L Smith Carr appeared by Zoom video, in custody at Walworth County Jail.  Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke in court for Paris L Smith Carr.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Atty. Redetzke provides an update; he believes his client is prepared to resolve the matter but he needs a little more time to discuss an appropriate resolution with the ADA assigned.  Court also notes the defendant still needs to have a preliminary hearing in the newer case, 22CF195.  Atty. Redetzke confirms that information, and is asking for a further proceedings date in about 30 days.  At that time he will also hope to do a preliminary hearing waiver in 22CF195 on that same date.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings in this matter, and possible waiver of preliminary hearing in 22CF195.  Court also notes that the preliminary hearing time limits were previously waived by defense back on 7/28/2022 in 22CF195.  Defendant to appear by Zoom video from the facility she is currently in custody at.  Atty. Redetzke to keep the clerk's office updated on where his client is currently in custody to have video set up for the next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by the State.
Hearing on September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:41 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Paris L Smith Carr appeared by phone, in custody at Dane Co. Jail.  Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke in court for Paris L Smith Carr.  Court notes the defendant was supposed to be by Zoom video but Dane Co. Jail was having computer problems.  Atty. Redetzke provides an update, he is requesting another further proceedings date in about 45-60 days.  Atty. Pitzo presents statements, he notes there is a referral but they are waiting for some additional information from law enforcement.  Atty. Pitzo also notes it is unlikely they will grant consolidation into the defendant's Dane Co. cases.  Court will adjourn for further proceedings.  Defendant to appear by video from Dane Co. Jail for the next court date.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Returned original warrant from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department for Paris L. Smith Carr issued on 02-02-2022 by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III.
Detainer placed at: Dane County Jail
Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact all Target stores.

02:19 PM Defendant Paris L Smith Carr appeared by phone, in custody Dane County Jail, with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke who appeared by phone.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court recalls the matter as we were able to get the Defendant on the phone.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Redetzke is appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.
Attorney Redetzke requests to put the matter before the Trial Court for a further proceedings and to waive prelim.
THE DEFENDANT IS CURRENTLY INCARCERATED AT DANE COUNTY JAIL, HOW THE DEFENDANT APPEARS AT THE NEXT COURT DATE WILL BE LEFT UP TO THE DISCRETION OF THE TRIAL COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:29 PM Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke appeared by phone.   Defendant Paris L Smith Carr did not appear, in custody in Dane County Jail.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that the Defendant is in custody, however out of the facility at Dane County Jail.
The Court wil leave the warrant remain and will rescheudle the matter.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
